item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司同意就许可证违规提前采取特别措施
item.description: 泰晤士水务有限公司（Thames Water Ltd.）同意接受独立审查，以避免因上个月违反许可证规定而被处以巨额罚款。【原文：Thames Water Ltd. agreed to independent scrutiny to avoid hefty fines for breaching its license last month.】

item.title: 原见 "技术指标显示日经 225 指数已触底反弹
item.description: 2011年海啸引发的日本股市溃败，根据准确预示短期底部的图表形态，日本股市数十年来最大的抛售暂时告一段落。【原文：The biggest selloff in decades for Japanese stocks is over for now, according to a chart pattern that accurately signaled the short-term bottom of a rout triggered by the 2011 tsunami.】

item.title: 迪拜机场在创纪录的半年度客流量后上调年度客流量预测
item.description: 迪拜国际机场在上半年吸引了创纪录的游客数量后，上调了今年的客流预测，超过了 2018 年最繁忙的客流。【原文：Dubai International Airport raised its forecast for passenger numbers this year, surpassing its busiest inflow in 2018, after the emirate attracted a record number of visitors in the first half.】

item.title: 美国销售强劲，日元走软，本田利润创历史新高
item.description: 本田汽车公司第一季度营业利润创历史新高，原因是美国市场的强劲销售抵消了中国市场的放缓，使这家日本第二大汽车制造商有望在今年再创利润新高。【原文：Honda Motor Co. operating profit rose to an all-time high in the first quarter as strong sales in the US overcame a slowdown in China, putting Japan’s second largest automaker in line for another year of record profit.】

item.title: 高盛认为中国电动汽车供过于求的局面将得到缓解
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）的分析师认为，中国的海外商品泛滥现象将在未来几年内发生改变，尽管电动汽车和钢铁行业的情况不太可能得到缓解。【原文：China’s overflow of goods abroad is set to change course in the next few years, according to Goldman Sachs analysts, though relief isn’t likely for electric vehicles and steel.】

item.title: 彪马因货运成本和中国经济放缓而下调盈利目标
item.description: 由于货运成本上升，消费者情绪低落，尤其是在中国，彪马 SE 下调了今年的利润预期。【原文：Puma SE watered down its profit outlook for the year amid higher freight costs and muted consumer sentiment, especially in China.】

item.title: 英国经济 2022 年的增长超过此前预期
item.description: 最新数据显示，2022 年英国经济产出增长较快，经受住了两位数通胀和政治动荡的影响，好于最初的预期。【原文：The UK economy weathered the impact of double-digit inflation and political turmoil better than initially thought in 2022, according to updated figures showing a faster rise in output.】

item.title: 德国工业生产因汽车增长超预期
item.description: 德国 6 月份的工业生产有所增长；这为欧洲最大经济体带来了一些好消息，因为上个季度该经济体意外萎缩。【原文：German industrial production rose in June — offering some good news for Europe’s largest economy after it unexpectedly shrank last quarter.】

item.title: 股东反对，Glencore放弃退出煤炭行业计划
item.description: Glencore Plc 在表示将退出煤炭业务后仅九个月，就放弃了分拆煤炭业务的计划。【原文：Glencore Plc has abandoned plans to spin off its coal unit just nine months after saying it would exit the profitable but polluting business, after discussions with its shareholders who pushed back against the plan.】

item.title: 英国 7 月房价跳涨，英国央行降息令前景光明
item.description: 2024 年 5 月 27 日星期一，英国伦敦，金丝雀码头金融、商业和购物区天际线上的住宅建筑。英国长期存在的住房短缺问题已成为执政党保守党和反对党工党在大选前的主要战场。摄影师：Hollie Adams/Bloomberg【原文：Residential properties in view of the Canary Wharf financial, business and shopping district skyline in London, UK, on Monday, May 27, 2024. item.title: 大陆集团下调对欧洲汽车市场疲软的展望
item.description: 大陆集团（Continental AG）下调了今年的业绩展望，原因是欧洲汽车市场的下滑幅度超过预期，而欧洲的电动汽车销售正在放缓。【原文：Continental AG lowered its outlook for the year on greater-than-expected declines in the European automotive market, where electric-vehicle sales are slowing.】

item.title: 印度企业避开全球担忧推进上市
item.description: 印度熙熙攘攘的首次公开募股市场正摆脱本周全球股市大跌的影响，以更大的首发规模向前迈进。【原文：India’s bustling initial public offering market is barreling ahead with bigger debuts, shrugging off this week’s global equity selloff.】

item.title: 德国商业银行宣布下一次股票回购，同时利润下降
item.description: 德国商业银行股份公司（Commerzbank AG）表示，由于首席执行官曼弗雷德-克诺夫（Manfred Knof）试图兑现增加派息的承诺，该公司已申请回购价值 6 亿欧元（6.55 亿美元）的新股。【原文：Commerzbank AG said it has applied for a new share buyback worth €600 million ($655 million) as Chief Executive Officer Manfred Knof seeks to deliver on a promise to increase payouts.】

item.title: 美国经济放缓阻碍中国出口驱动型经济复苏之路
item.description: 中国的出口引擎对中国保持 5%左右的增长目标至关重要，但现在却受到美国需求下滑迹象的威胁，而中国政府也在努力刺激本国的消费经济。【原文：China’s export engine, vital for keeping the country’s growth target of around 5% within reach, is now threatened by signs of sagging US demand, just as Beijing is also struggling to jolt its own consumer economy.】

item.title: 炼油企业回归现实，新工厂侵蚀巨额利润
item.description: 随着新一代超大型炼油厂的投产和中国经济的衰退，石油加工商的黄金利润期正在消失。【原文：A golden period of profits for oil processors is fading as a new generation of mega refineries comes online and China’s powerhouse economy falters.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司将以 7 亿美元从住友商事手中购买 PetroRabigh 石油公司股份
item.description: 沙特阿美公司同意以约 7 亿美元的价格从其合资伙伴住友化学株式会社手中购买 PetroRabigh 的额外股份。【原文：Saudi Aramco agreed to buy an additional stake in PetroRabigh from its joint venture partner Sumitomo Chemical Co. for about $700 million.】

item.title: 尽管经济疲软，中国金属和电力燃料进口依然坚挺
item.description: 尽管经济疲软和夏季工业活动冷清，但中国 7 月份的金属和发电厂燃料进口仍保持增长，而原油需求则进一步显示出疲软迹象。【原文：Chinese imports of metals and power plant fuels held up in July, despite a softer economy and the summer lull in industrial activity, while crude oil demand flashed further signs of weakness.】

item.title: 星展银行盈利超出预期，贷款和财富管理费均有增长
item.description: 星展集团控股有限公司（DBS Group Holdings Ltd.）第二季度利润超过预期，因为这家新加坡最大的贷款机构继续受益于较高的贷款收入和强劲的财富管理费用。【原文：DBS Group Holdings Ltd.’s second-quarter profit beat estimates as Singapore’s biggest lender continued to benefit from higher lending income and strong wealth management fees.】

item.title: 中国人民银行决定自 2020 年以来首次放弃现金投放
item.description: 中国经济的资金如此充裕，以至于央行自 2020 年以来首次选择不向金融市场注入任何短期现金。【原文：China’s economy is so flush with funds that the central bank chose not to make any short-term cash injections into the financial market for the first time since 2020.】

item.title: 印度考虑大幅削减新消费物价指数篮子中的食品权重
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，印度政府一个负责修订全国消费者价格指数的小组正在考虑大幅削减食品的权重，此举可能会抑制这个南亚国家的通胀飙升。【原文：An Indian government panel tasked with revising the nation’s consumer price index is considering a substantial cut in the weighting of food, according to a person familiar with the matter, a move that could curb inflation spikes in the South Asian nation.】

item.description: 全球市场崩溃增加了罗马尼亚央行的风险，因为该央行正在权衡通胀放缓是否值得连续第二次降低利率。【原文：A global market meltdown added to risks for Romania’s central bank as it weighs whether slowing inflation merits lowering interest rates for a second consecutive meeting.】

item.title: 日本央行言论助推日韩股市上涨，亚洲股市上涨
item.description: 在日本央行表示如果金融市场不稳定就不会加息后，亚洲股市在周一的全球经济衰退后连续第二个交易日上涨。【原文：Asian equities advanced for a second session following Monday’s global rout, after the Bank of Japan said it won’t raise interest rates if financial markets are unstable.】

item.title: 中国出口连续第四个月增长但贸易顺差缩小
item.description: 中国出口连续第四个月增长，但在国内支出没有增加的情况下，这一增长可能不足以刺激经济。【原文：China’s exports grew for a fourth straight month, an uplift that’s likely insufficient to spur the economy in the absence of stronger domestic spending.】

item.title: 分析师称，日本央行的评论表明目前有意抑制日元升值
item.description: 据市场观察人士称，日本央行的评论表明其对近期的市场动荡感到不安，并预示着日元未来的潜在上行空间较小。【原文：Comments from the Bank of Japan signal discomfort with recent market turbulence, and augur less potential upside for the yen going forward, according to market watchers.】
